page.title: 11CROOME CURIOSITIES.
page.content:
{DUNSTALL CASTLE } The 'Castle' stands on Dunstall Common It is a sham Norman ruin, built to be viewed from Croome Court in 1769 by the sixth Earl of Coventry and designed by Adam. It consists of two round towers with a high archway between them. At an angle from one tower, a wall leads to a trefoil -cusped archway and a thin square tower.
{THE TOWER HOUSE. } The octagonal Tower House, built circa 1750, was originally owned by the Coventry family as a hunting lodge and 'look out' to enable servants to warn Croome Court of the approach of coaches. Today it is used as a private dwelling and has magnificent views of the surrounding countryside.
